file_content.text: For the record, I wanted to go find you. Theron ordered me not to. I almost punched him.
You know better than to worry about me.
Who said I was worried? I just wanted to go for a nice walk with my favorite commander.
We're all five by five, Commander. It's no Havoc Squad, but your people are good soldiers.
I imagine you had it the easiest out there, with your experience.
It's not the first hostile landing zone I've been dropped in, but it's definitely the strangest.
Something about this place reminds me of training camp. The random drop zones, scattered resources, progressive enemy patrols...
You think we're in some kind of simulation.
This weird little remote patched me up a couple of times. Everything else wanted me dead. Like I said... strange.
I love it when you come back smelling like blood and ozone. Did you miss me?
Exploring would've been a lot more fun with you. I had to settle for the Mandalorian.
Poor baby.
Welcome to your home away from home, Commander. Theron says you've been busy.
So... how many Zakuulans did you get out there?
I forgot to count.
I bagged twenty-six and a half. Wonder if whoever dumped us here noticed.
Maybe they're seeing who's stronger before they pick a side.
Or they just enjoy the show, like me.
Thanks for the vote of confidence. You won't regret it.
You change your mind about things, I'll be here... trying not to get shot.
Still sore from that punch you gave me. Now's probably not a good time to talk.
All I could think about outside was finding you. I still don't understand how we wound up so far apart.
Whoever's doing this isolated us for a reason--but they could never separate us for long.
You've got that right.
Glad you're okay, Commander. I'm, uh, not much for talking right now. Jaw's a little sore.
I hear Vette found something in that monument. She's waiting for you.
Now that you're here, I feel a lot better. We all do.
You seem to have done all right on your own.
This planet's no place to fly solo, I can tell you that.
Something happened on my way here. I met a Zakuulan naval officer from the Eternal Fleet. He wanted to surrender.
I don't see him. What happened?
Crazy droids attacked us. He tried to run, but they got him. I felt bad for the guy.
He told me everyone in the fleet is terrified of Vaylin. I don't think it'll take much to turn them against her.
When I woke up on this world and couldn't contact you... I've had too many awful moments like that, lately.
Voss, Dromund Kaas, and now this place. We never seem to get a break.
Remind me to schedule some personal time when we're home.
Commander, I'm glad you're safe.
Theron thinks we're in a sanctuary, but I'm not convinced.
It's better than what's outside.
Exactly. The other structures were destroyed long ago, but this one's perfectly preserved--almost as if we're meant to take shelter in it.
Someone brought us to this world. Until we know why, we can't take anything for granted.
I never do.
Leave the home improvements to me. You should find Vette.
I'll secure this entrance while you check on the others.
